intro: Callicarpa longissima, commonly known as the Chinese beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, violet-blue berries that appear in the fall. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically dark green and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. The berries are not only visually striking but also attract birds and other wildlife.
